results.title: The Last days of disco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Whit Stillman, Castle Rock and Westerly Films
results.brief_description: It is the very early 1980s. Alice (Chloe Sevigny) and Charlotte (Kate Beckinsale) are two ambitious publishing assistants who transform themselves into glamourous disco queens and spend their nights dancing at The Club. That is until their disco-world is turned upside down by a seemingly bisexual lothario, Des (Chris Eigeman), whose involvement with drugs lands him and his money-siphoning friends in trouble with the law. A hilarious tale of tangled romances, friendship and music you just can’t stop dancing to!

results.title: Empire of passion = Ai no Borei = Phantom of love
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Anatole Dauman, Argos Films and Oshima Productions
results.brief_description: Following the world-wide success of his highly erotic and controversial ‘Ai No Corrida’ (The Realm of the Senses) in 1976, Oshima directed a companion piece, ‘Empire of Passion’, but this time set in late 19th century rural Japan. Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji), a soldier, returns from the first Chinese War and embarks on a passionate affair with Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), a woman twenty years his senior and married to a hard-drinking rickshaw man. They soon conspire to murder the husband and throw his body down a disused well. Three years later, the husband’s ghost returns to haunt the lovers, thus hastening their downfall. Like much of Oshima’s work the film is based on facts. It also follows Oshima’s defiant stance against Japan’s strict censorship laws and moral codes. However, ‘Ai No Borei’ is less concerned with steamy eroticism than the aftermath of an all consuming passion, namely the devastating effect of guilt. ‘Ai No Borei’ is a straight forward crime of passion story in the vein of ‘The Postman Always Rings Twice’ with the added thrill of an Asian ghost story. Adapted from a novel by Itoko Namura, ‘Ai No Borei’ is also known as ‘Phantom of Love’. Nagisa Oshima was awarded the Best Director Prize at the Cannes Film Festival in 1978. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: It's my party
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Harry Knapp and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Nick Stark (Eric Roberts) is a Los Angeles architect who has it all - graced with vitality, good looks, loyal friends, a thriving career, a down-to-earth attitude and an irreverent sense of humor. Although he looks healthy, he has been fighting off AIDS related illnesses for years, and he discovers that he has untreatable brain lesions which will, at best, decimate all his brain faculties within days and he may die within a week. He intends to savour his remaining time by gathering everyone he loves for a two-day farewell party. Nick is a generous host to the diverse crowd he attracts. He draws his guests into a highly charged atmosphere where opinions collide, secrets spill, and old wounds heal as everyone struggles to accept Nick’s fate.

results.title: Hotel colonial (D)
results.creator_credit: Cinzia Th Torrini, Ira Barmak, Hemdale Film Corporation and Legeis Theatrical
results.brief_description: Early one morning, Marco (John Savage), an Italo-American living in America, is awoken by a phone call delivering the news of his brother’s death, Luca, a shady character involved in the Italian mafia and terrorism. Marco heads to Bogota, Columbia, where his brother allegedly committed suicide, in order to identify the body and bring him home. However, all is not what it seems when Marco discovers the body is not his brother’s and the suicide may be a murder. Marco is determined to find his brother, and based on a few clues that point him to a small village in remote Columbia, and knowledge of his brothers’ various aliases and his involvement in drug trafficking, he begins the journey of unravelling the truth. Throughout the search, Marco meets a few characters, becomes acquainted with the locals and learns to appreciate the innocence, natural beauty though indisputable poverty of this small Columbian village. However, upon closer inspection of his environment, Marco also sees the evil, corruption and exploitation that transpire in this small village. It’s only in the depths of this dark and uncivilised land that Marco confronts the true and shocking reality of his brother’s whereabouts, and that he learns its corruption is inseparable from the activities of his own flesh and blood. Despite its cliched plot scenarios and mediocre performances, “Hotel Colonial” shows some genuine concern for the plight of South American peoples though from the perspective of a white American male. Cast also includes Robert Duvall and Rachel Ward. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: She's having a baby
results.brief_description:
John Hughes’ romantic comedy of yuppie angst stars Kevin Bacon and Elizabeth McGovern as Jake and Kristi Briggs. Jake, after falling in love with Kristi at first sight, is beginning to have second thoughts about ending his single life as he is walking down the aisle on their wedding day. A year later their dreams of a perfect life in a perfect house have turned into a series of hilarious marital nightmares. Kristi has just received news that really ought to make things interesting - she’s pregnant.
Cast also includes: Alec Baldwin, Lili Taylor

results.title: Moving in = Firstborn
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Paul Junger Witt, Ron Koslow, Tony Thomas, Jaffe-Lansing Productions, Paramount Pictures, Thomas Productions and Witt
results.brief_description: A story of relationships, love, loyalty and family - and intruders who upset the balance. Wendy (Teri Garr) is a young divorced mother with two sons, Jake (Christopher Collet) and Brian (Corey Haim). Mother and sons appear to cope reasonably well in their relationships towards one another with the usual generational disagreements and ups and downs all families face at one time or another. However, when Sam (Peter Weller) enters into Wendy’s life, the boys find themselves gradually being pushed aside as their mother’s interest in Sam turns increasingly to love. When Sam moves in, both Jake and Brian become suspicious of his motives and eventually it is up to Jake, as first born, to try and take control of a situation that is rapidly getting out of hand. Both boys are determined to protect their mother at all costs but for Jake it is a moment of confrontation and making choices. Contains some violent scenes. Cast also includes a very young Sarah Jessica Parker as Jake’s girlfriend, Lisa and Robert Downey Jr (also in his teens) as one of Jake’s friends, Lee.

results.title: Boardwalk
results.brief_description: An old Jewish couple the Rosens (Ruth Gordon and Lee Strasberg) who migrated to Brooklyn, New York after the war have lived in harmony within a mostly ageing community until now… Threatened from the increasing violence of street gangs who target the elderly and most vulnerable, the Rosens stick to their convictions, determined to keep home - home. As the attacks escalate and Becky Rosen’s health declines David Rosen is forced to take the law into his own hands. Director Verona manages to achieve a sense of empathy as he removes all formal symbols of law and order creating a playing field where it is every man for themselves. Cast includes: Janet Leigh, and Joe Silver.

results.title: Hurricane express
results.creator_credit: Armand Schaefer, J.P. McGowan, Nat Levine and Mascot Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description:
A saboteur known as “The Wrecker” is attempting to destroy the L&R railroad company in order to bolster an airline competing for the same route. When Larry Baker (John Wayne), a young air transport pilot finds out that his father, the railroad’s chief engineer, has been killed in one of a series of train wrecks, he is determined to track down the culprit. The villain’s talents as a master of disguise make his apprehension extremely difficult as a number of other characters come under suspicion. After a series of hair-raising attacks on the Hurricane Express, Baker eventually saves the day and the damsel (Shirley Grey) he loves.

Originally conceived and filmed as a twelve part serial, this version was truncated to a feature-length film for cinema release.

This film was co-directed by J.P. McGowan, an Australian-born actor/director and a founding father of the Hollywood motion picture industry.

results.creator_credit: Lewis R. Foster, William H Pine, William Thomas and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A man escaping from a political feud takes refuge in a banana port in Central America where he attempts to save a plantation from being taken over by crooks. Cast includes Ronald Reagan and Rhonda Fleming. Based on the novel “Gentlemen of the jungle” by Tom Gill.

results.title: Day of wrath
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Set in 17th century Europe, “Day of Wrath” is an intense and tragic study of how a young woman is destroyed by the charge of witchcraft. Anne is married to the much older pastor, Absalon Pedersson. She is attracted to her step-son Martin and when Absalon dies of a heart attack, the accusations begin that his death was caused through Anne’s sorcery. Now considered one of the great works of European cinema, “Day of Wrath” is not interested in the occult as much as it explores the psychology of harsh puritanism, especially the debilitating effects of such repression on women. From her initial horror at the accusations, to her remorse and final acceptance, Anne’s story transcends the supernatural and becomes a terrifyingly contemporary study of alienation and emotional betrayal. Based on the play “Anne Pedersdotter” by Wiers Jenssens, Dreyer has reconceived the story and created one of the great feminist works of cinema. Released in Denmark during the Nazi occupation, “Day of Wrath” resonates as a study of terror, hatred and collaboration. With Thorkid Roose, Ilsbeth Movin and Sigrid Neiiendam. In Danish with English subtitles.
